newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Hanbo Steel shares resume trading.
newsitem.headline: Hanbo Steel shares resume trading.

text.p: Trading of Hanbo Steel Co shares resumed on Monday and the stock was placed under the "watch list", the Korea Stock Exchange said.
Trading in the company's shares was suspended for the past two days after the steelmaker defaulted on debt repayments on Thursday, he said.
The exchange spokesman said price quotation would be made only twice -- at the end of the morning and afternoon sessions.
Hanbo closed at 5,390 won per share on the last trading session on Thursday, but its base price for Monday was set at 4,960 won, he said.
The base price was set after the exchange received buy and sell orders before trading started, he said.
On Thursday, Hanbo defaulted on debt repayments. -- Seoul Newsroom (822) 727 5646
